entry.title: Google forms default form title re-appears when Backspace is pressed.
entry.content:
Chrome Version :123.0.6300.4 (Official Build) canary (64-bit) 15790.0.0 (Official Build) canary-channel nami
OS: Chrome OS
Steps to reproduce: Launch Chrome. Navigate to ‘https://forms.google.com/’ Click on "+" button in the template pane Select the default form title i.e ‘Untitled form’ and press backspace button. Observe.
Actual Result : Google forms default form title re-appears when Backspace is pressed.
Expected Result : Google forms default form title should not re-appear when Backspace is pressed.
Please find the attached screen cast below..!
Note: 1.Issue is reproducible on Canary #123.0.6300.4, Dev #123.0.6300.4, Beta # 122.0.6261.68, Stable #121.0.6167.208 2.This is a NR issue.
Thank You

entry.title: .Observe that the coordinates are not able to be seen while mouse hovering on “Search apps”, “Google apps”and “Profile pic”.
entry.content:
Chrome Version :123.0.6300.4 (Official Build) canary (64-bit)
Revision: c1e70ee2d242ef3064f63e359d9b2fbe780bcf8b-refs/branch-heads/6300@{#11}
OS: Chrome OS
Steps to reproduce: 1. Launch Chrome 2. Open NTP 3. Click on 3 dots and click on “More tools” 4. Click on “Developer tools” 5. Click on inspect selector button 6. Focus the mouse hover “Search apps”, “Google apps”and “Profile pic”. 7.Observe that the coordinates are not able to be seen while mouse hovering on “Search apps”, “Google apps”and “Profile pic”.
Actual Result :Observe that the Coordinates are not able to be seen while mousing over "Search apps", "Google apps" and "Profile pic"
Expected Result : Coordinates should able to be seen while mousing over "Search apps", "Google apps" and "Profile pic"
Please find the attached screen cast below..!
Note: 1.Issue able to repro on Canary#123.0.6300.4,Beta#122.0.6261.68,Stable#121.0.6167.208,Dev#123.0.6300.4 2.This is an NR issue.
Thank You

entry.title: Suggest Password feature doesn't work with shadow DOM password input
entry.content:
# Steps to reproduce the problem 1. Create a simple form with a simple web component password input 2. Login to to Chrome and enable password suggestion 3. Focus on the input or right-click for Suggest Password 4. IF Suggest Password omnibox is opened, choose generated password
# Problem Description When using a custom password input with a web component, Chrome doesn't work well with its shadow DOM and does not open the OmniBox nor does it work well when right-clicking and choosing "Suggest Password".
Few scenarios: - OmniBox should open automatically (it does not) - When clicking on "Suggest Password" the suggested password appears inside the input, but doesn't trigger change, nor does it eventually change the input's value, and after blur the input remains empty. - Tested against Stable & Canary - different behaviors occur, with same results.
# Additional Comments A/B Tested with Canary's experiment "Shadow DOM support for Password Manager" - same results.
# Summary Suggest Password feature doesn't work with shadow DOM password input
# Custom Questions #### Which component does this fall under? Not sure - I don't know
#### Does this work in other browsers? Yes - This is just a Chrome problem
# Additional Data Category: API \ Chrome Channel: Stable \ Regression: Yes

entry.title: Data in an IndexedDB index with empty string as the name are displayed incorrectly
Fatal error in Cycle in flag implications: in flags.cc
entry.content:
Detailed Report: https://clusterfuzz.com/testcase?key=4655077081415680
Fuzzer: ochang_js_fuzzer Job Type: linux_asan_v8_inspector_dbg Platform Id: linux
Crash Type: Fatal error Crash Address: Crash State: Cycle in flag implications: in flags.cc v8::internal::ImplicationProcessor::EnforceImplications v8::internal::FlagList::EnforceFlagImplications
Sanitizer: address (ASAN)
Crash Revision: https://clusterfuzz.com/revisions?job=linux_asan_v8_inspector_dbg&revision=92464
Reproducer Testcase: https://clusterfuzz.com/download?testcase_id=4655077081415680
Issue manually filed by: machenbach
To reproduce this, please build the target in this report and run it against the reproducer testcase. Please use the GN arguments provided at bottom of this report when building the binary.
If you have trouble reproducing, please also export the environment variables listed under "[Environment]" in the crash stacktrace.
If you have any feedback on reproducing test cases, let us know at https://forms.gle/Yh3qCYFveHj6E5jz5 so we can improve.

entry.title: The Ultimate Guide: How to Wash Your Hey Dude Shoes
entry.content:
Hey Dude shoes have become a popular choice for those seeking comfort, style, and durability. Whether you're rocking the Wally, the Wendy, or any other Hey Dude model, keeping them clean is essential for maintaining their quality and extending their lifespan. In this comprehensive guide, we'll walk you through the best practices for washing your Hey Dude shoes to ensure they stay fresh and looking their best.
Understanding Your Hey Dude Shoes: Before diving into the washing process, it's essential to understand the construction of your Hey Dude shoes. Most Hey Dude shoes feature a lightweight design with breathable canvas uppers and a flexible sole. While this construction makes them incredibly comfortable, it also means they require special care when washing to avoid damage.
Read More: https://healthylifehuman.com/how-to-wash-hey-dudes/
Materials Needed:
Mild detergent or shoe cleaner Soft-bristled brush or sponge Water Towel Optional: Washing machine or hand-washing basin Step-by-Step Washing Guide:
Step 1: Remove Dirt and Debris Start by removing any loose dirt or debris from the surface of your Hey Dude shoes. Use a soft-bristled brush or sponge to gently brush away dirt from the canvas uppers and the sole. Be careful not to scrub too hard, as this could damage the material.
Step 2: Prepare the Cleaning Solution Fill a basin or sink with lukewarm water and add a small amount of mild detergent or shoe cleaner. Mix the solution until it creates a soapy mixture. Alternatively, you can use a pre-made shoe cleaning solution according to the manufacturer's instructions.
Step 3: Spot Clean Dip the soft-bristled brush or sponge into the cleaning solution and gently scrub any stains or soiled areas on your Hey Dude shoes. Work in small circular motions, focusing on one section at a time. Take care not to oversaturate the canvas, as excessive moisture can cause damage.
Step 4: Clean the Insoles If your Hey Dude shoes have removable insoles, take them out and wash them separately. Use the same cleaning solution and gentle scrubbing motion to remove dirt and odors from the insoles. Once clean, rinse them thoroughly with water and allow them to air dry.
Step 5: Rinse After spot cleaning, rinse your Hey Dude shoes thoroughly with clean water to remove any remaining soap residue. Ensure all soap suds are completely washed away to prevent any buildup that could damage the material over time.
Step 6: Air Dry Once cleaned and rinsed, gently pat your Hey Dude shoes with a towel to remove excess water. Avoid wringing or twisting the shoes, as this could misshape them. Stuff the shoes with clean, dry towels or newspaper to help them retain their shape as they dry. Place them in a well-ventilated area away from direct heat or sunlight and allow them to air dry completely.
Optional: Machine Washing Some Hey Dude shoes are machine washable, but it's essential to check the care instructions specific to your shoe model before attempting this method. If machine washing is recommended, place your Hey Dude shoes in a mesh laundry bag to protect them during the wash cycle. Use a gentle or delicate cycle with cold water and a mild detergent. Once the cycle is complete, remove the shoes from the laundry bag and allow them to air dry as outlined above.
Conclusion: Properly washing your Hey Dude shoes is key to keeping them looking and feeling great for years to come. By following these simple steps and using gentle cleaning techniques, you can maintain the quality and longevity of your favorite pair. Whether you opt for hand washing or machine washing, always be sure to check the care instructions provided by Hey Dude to ensure you're caring for your shoes correctly. With the right care, your Hey Dude shoes will continue to provide comfort and style for many adventures ahead.

entry.title: [Chromium GSoC] Question about project length/interest expression (sanitize-safety)
entry.content:
Hello! I am really interested in this project as it is related to my fields of interest and would be a great opportunity to hone my C++ skills contributing to opensource. The problem is that I've seen in the slides that it has a length of 22 weeks, which sadly would be a conflict with my exchange semester for university. Is there any chance it could be converted into a 12 weeks project cutting some parts and focusing on the core functionality? Also, would you recommend any specific Chromebook for testing? Is the product mentioned in the related bug still a valid choice?
Thank you very much for your time!
Emanuele

entry.title: Security warning message is shown while installing the builds.
entry.content:
Chrome Version:124.0.6315.0
OS: Linux(Debian)
Steps: 1.Download chrome.deb from the Google Cloud bucket. 2.Open Terminal and navigate to the Downloads(cd Downloads). 3.Enter sudo dpkg -i "filename.deb" in the terminal and observe.
Actual Result: Security warning message is shown while installing the builds.
Expected Result: No Security warning message should be shown.
Please find the attached screenshots for reference.
Note: 1) Issue is not seen while trying with alternative command as shown in the screenshot. 2) Issue is seen only in Corp machines.
Someone from the dev team could anyone confirm whether this is caused by chrome builds or we should use any other alternative commands.
Thanks

You can help us a lot by creating a minimal, reproducible example (https://stackoverflow.com/help/minimal-reproducible-example), e.g. on glitch.com, and/or attaching a screenshot or recording of the issue!

entry.title: Black thumbnails in the Tab Grid
entry.content:
Chrome Version: 121.0.6167.171 (Chrome for iOS)
What steps will reproduce the problem? (1) Start Chrome (2) Go into the tab grid (3) Some tab thumbnails appear black. I couldn't notice a pattern, it's not the last tab, it doesn't happen after a certain action, it's often some random tab in the middle of the grid.
What is the expected result? That all thumbnails in the tab grid are visible.
What happens instead? Some tabs' thumbnails are black.

entry.title: Host is unable to send reactions when it is turned off for participants in host controls for Google meet
entry.content:
Chrome Version: 124.0.6315.1 (Official Build) canary-dcheck (arm64) aa3da645dc1961d5ac5e29e3d76a0925084bfbc7-refs/branch-heads/6315@{#2}
OS : Mac,Win(10,11),Linux
Preconditions: None
Steps to reproduce: 1. Launch Chrome and create any instant meet 2. Go to host controls and turn on host management 3. Turn off send reactions for participants 4. Observe that reactions are disabled for host also
Actual Result: Reactions are disabled for host
Expected Result: Reactions must be disabled for only participants and host must be able to send reactions
This issue exists from M-112 onwards .So, raising it as a NR issue.
Please refer to the screencast below: https://drive.google.com/file/d/1inU011X1QYC6dMU3tuPgK3MdiI_-LiFI/view?usp=drive_link
Notes: 1)This issue able to repro on Beta #123.0.6312.4, Dev #123.0.6300.3 and Stable #122.0.6261.57 2)As this is a Non-Regression issue, changing the status to Untriaged so that the issue would get addressed.
Thanks..!!

entry.title: Regression : Chrome NTP opening tabstrip animation is weird ie tab is sliding from left to right
entry.content:
Chrome Version : 124.0.6315.0 (Official Build) (64-bit) (cohort: Stable Installs & Version Pins) Revision : 64a22dee8d3180a73913a234898779f5d96755bd-refs/branch-heads/6315@{#1}
OS: Win(11, 10), Mac and Linux
Pre Conditions: None
Steps to reproduce: 1. Launch Chrome 2. Open NTP 3. Observe new tab opening tabstrip animation ie tab on the tabstrip is sliding from left to right
Actual Result : NTP opening tabstrip animation is weird ie tab is sliding from left to right
Expected Result : Previous NTP opening tabstrip animation was better no need for slide animation
This is a regression issue broken in M-124
Good Build : 123.0.6312.9 (Revision: 1262506) Bad Build : 124.0.6315.0 (Revision: 1263720)
Manual Bisect Info:
Suspect : https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src.git/+/70dd4a0d815b34d85fb84afdbfe24d38aa200d43
@David Pennington: Could you please check whether this is caused with respect to your change, if not please help us in assigning it to the right owner.
Please find the screencast link attached below..!
Actual Result: https://drive.google.com/file/d/1CeB3EXISgSOuo-80JuWJQO5f5Ei1YpqQ/view?usp=drivesdk
Note: 1. Repro on Win, Mac and Linux Canary builds
Thank You

entry.title: android.content.res.Resources$NotFoundException: Resource ID #0x20c0006
entry.content:
# Steps to reproduce the problem 1. Work with webviews in Android 2. Intermittent crashes, varying devices 3.
# Problem Description On January 24th, we started having spikes in of an issue occurring within the DeviceFormFactor utility.
It points out that it was not possible to find the R.integer.min_screen_width_bucket resource.
It crashes different devices, but mostly OnePlus.
This is the log that we receive: Caused by android.content.res.Resources$NotFoundException: Resource ID #0x20c0006 at android.content.res.ResourcesImpl.getValue(ResourcesImpl.java:255) at android.content.res.MiuiResourcesImpl.getValue(MiuiResourcesImpl.java:96) at android.content.res.Resources.getInteger(Resources.java:1243) at org.chromium.ui.base.DeviceFormFactor.isTablet(chromium-TrichromeWebViewGoogle6432.aab-stable-616716433:9) at android.os.MessageQueue.nativePollOnce(MessageQueue.java) at android.os.MessageQueue.next(MessageQueue.java:340) at android.os.Looper.loopOnce(Looper.java:169) at android.os.Looper.loop(Looper.java:300) at android.app.ActivityThread.main(ActivityThread.java:8301) at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Method.java) at com.android.internal.os.RuntimeInit$MethodAndArgsCaller.run(RuntimeInit.java:577) at com.android.internal.os.ZygoteInit.main(ZygoteInit.java:1076)

entry.title: Avoid hard-coding confidence threshold for chrome://predictors
entry.content:
See https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5312217/comment/d0d9cee6_879f6907/
We hard-code confidence threshold for Omnibox prerendering in 2 places: - chrome/browser/predictors/autocomplete_action_predictor.cc - chrome/browser/resources/predictors/autocomplete_action_predictor.ts
This is not preferable in terms of code maintainability. Instead, we should define the values only in autocomplete_action_predictor.cc and then pass them up to autocomplete_action_predictor.ts.

entry.content:
I tired to ssh to this bot. But couldn't find a way. https://chromium-swarm.appspot.com/bot?id=mac-78-g585
I tried this command since it doesn't look covered by .ssh/chrome.config.
``` ssh -J swarming-ssh-proxy@ssh-dev-g.chromium.org chrome-bot@mac-78-g585 -v ``` Log: http://gpaste/4524067933126656
I also ran the following gcert commands.
``` gcert -prodssh=true gcert --chrome_golo ```
Btw, it seems there are 2 docs. Which one is updated?
- http://go/chrome-labs-ssh - https://chrome-internal.googlesource.com/infra/infra_internal/+/master/doc/ssh.md

entry.title: Fix colors on chrome://predictors
entry.content:
Columns on chrome://predictors are colored with yellow (for preconnect-able entries whose confidnce is over 50) or green (for prerender-able entries whose confidence is over 80). However, this is not aligned with actual implementation of preconnect and prerender: we decreased the confidence thresholds to 30 for preconnect and 50 for prerender (see [1, 2]). This is confusing users and should be fixed.
[1]https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:chrome/browser/predictors/autocomplete_action_predictor.cc;l=66-75;drc=669135887abc2cd3d611bd7edf913569d3586077 [2]https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:chrome/browser/predictors/autocomplete_action_predictor.cc;l=290-299;drc=669135887abc2cd3d611bd7edf913569d3586077

Chrome Version: (copy from chrome://version) Lacros Version (if applicable): (copy from chrome://version) OS: (e.g. Win10, MacOS 10.12, etc...)
What steps will reproduce the problem? (1) (2) (3)
What is the expected result?
What happens instead?
Please use hotlists and text to provide additional information.
If this is a regression (i.e., worked before), please consider using the bisect tool (https://www.chromium.org/developers/bisect-builds-py) to help us identify the root cause and more rapidly triage the issue.
For graphics-related bugs, please copy/paste the contents of the about://gpu page at the end of this report.

entry.title: UXSS (Universal Cross Site Scripting)
entry.content:
UXSS (Universal Cross-Site Scripting),the script that I created via chrome://extensions, will run in the background and createBookmark then manipulate the bookmark URL with JS code which produces UXSS
The impact is that attackers can execute JS Stealing Cookie code, and leak information
Step: 1. open chrome://extensions/ 2. Load Unpacked 3. Enter the code into the extension 4. i will give POC video and Script
video POC : https://drive.google.com/file/d/19Fu8Cwq_hscypvdMDM1lppjZSz_M0dT-/view?usp=sharing
